hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Transition on Failed Breakout & Options Flow
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL regimes, when BTC attempts but fails to break above key resistance (previous high -2%) on increased volume, and options put/call ratio spikes >1.3 within 24 hours of the failed breakout, the regime will transition to BEAR within 3 days with >68% probability.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Failed breakouts at resistance indicate lack of buying conviction. When combined with smart money hedging (elevated put/call ratio), it suggests institutional expectation of downside. Increasing OI during rejection shows new short positioning.
entry_conditions: BTC tests resistance within 2% of 30-day high
Rejection occurs (close below resistance after testing)
Volume on rejection day >20% above 10-day average
Deribit BTC options put/call ratio >1.3 within 24 hours of rejection

exit_conditions.take_profit: Regime shifts to BEAR (confidence >65%) OR BTC price drops 7% from rejection level
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC successfully breaks resistance within 2 days OR regime remains NEUTRAL for 5+ days

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 35% of such failed breakouts with options signals lead to eventual successful breakout and BULL transition instead.
